alert.note: Alert for McLean; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:14AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Woodford, northeastern Tazewell and McLean Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 214 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Deer Creek to near Stanford. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bloomington around 220 AM CDT. Heyworth around 225 AM CDT. Downs and Carlock around 230 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Normal, Le Roy, El Paso, Hudson, Lexington, Gridley and Towanda. This includes the following highways... Interstate 39 between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 55 between mile markers 146 and 180. Interstate 74 between mile markers 105 and 151. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for central Illinois.
